meanings.def: used with plural nouns and a plural verb to mean ‘a small number’, ‘some’
examples: We've had a few replies.
I need a few things from the store.
Quite a few people are going to arrive early.
I try to visit my parents every few weeks.

meanings.def: used with plural nouns and a plural verb to mean ‘not many’
examples: Few people understand the difference.
There seem to be fewer tourists around this year.
Very few students learn Latin now.
The player with the fewest points wins.

related: have been around the block (a few times)

meanings.def: a small number of people, things or places; some
examples: I recognized a few of the other people.
I've seen most of his movies. Only a few are as good as his first one.
Could you give me a few more details?

meanings.def: not many people, things or places
examples: Very few of his books are worth reading.
You can pass with as few as 25 points.
(formal) Few will argue with this conclusion.
Fewer than 20 students passed all the exams.
There are no fewer than 100 different species in the area.

meanings.def: used with a plural verb to mean ‘a small group of people’
examples: Real power belongs to the few.
She was one of the chosen few (= the small group with special rights).

meanings.def: to have had enough alcohol to make you drunk

examples: I've been there quite a few times.

idioms.def: to have had enough alcohol to make you drunk

examples: I've been there quite a few times.
